definition: abbr. for Ningxia Hui Autonomous Region 寧夏回族自治區|宁夏回族自治区[Ning2 xia4 Hui2 zu2 Zi4 zhi4 qu1]/abbr. for Nanjing 南京[Nan2 jing1]/surname Ning

sentences.english: Facing the enemies, our soldiers would die rather than surrender.
sentences.chinese: 面对敌人，我们的战士宁死不屈。

sentences.english: The warrior would as soon die as surrender.
For the protection of ZhongLiang blood, shaolin the monk would die rather than surrender, strive to resist.
sentences.chinese: 为保护忠良的血脉，少林众僧宁死不屈，奋力抵抗。

sentences.english: Surrender to the enemy? We will die first .
sentences.chinese: 向敌人投降？我们宁死不屈。

sentences.english: The soldier preferred to die rather than give in.
Liu Hulan would rather die than surrender before the enemy.
sentences.chinese: 刘胡兰在敌人面前宁死不屈。

sentences.english: He would rather die than surrender under the enemy's cruel torture.
sentences.chinese: 在敌人的酷刑之下，他宁死不屈。

sentences.english: The hero preferred to die rather than surrender.
Facing too, the field of torture, JiDePing silence to die rather than give in.
sentences.chinese: 面对太田的严刑拷打，季德平沉默以对宁死不屈。

sentences.english: He said he would die first.
Many people preferred to die rather than surrender during the war.
sentences.chinese: 在战争期间，许多人宁死不屈。

definition: to view death as a return home/to not be afraid of dying/to face death with equanimity (idiom)
not to submit to force (idiom); to defy threats and violence
heroically sacrificing one's life (idiom); to sacrifice oneself fervently to the cause
devotion to righteousness that inspires reverence (idiom)
to vow to die rather than obey (idiom)
Better broken jade than intact tile./Death is preferable to dishonor. (idiom)
pinyin: ning4 wei2 yu4 sui4 , bu4 wei2 wa3 quan2

definition: to give up life for righteousness (idiom, from Mencius); to choose honor over life/would rather sacrifice one's life than one's principles
not to submit to force (idiom); to defy threats and violence
